findings.title: DLQ entries lost on process restart — no persistence layer (DEFERRED)
findings.description: Carried forward from iteration 1. The in-memory DLQ has no persistence. This is an architectural gap requiring its own planning cycle (DLQStore interface + Redis adapter). Not addressable within bridge fix sprints.
findings.suggestion: Defer to dedicated sprint. Track via issue or backlog item.

findings.title: Clean json_escape() implementation with proper control character handling
findings.description: The awk-based json_escape() function correctly handles all JSON-sensitive characters: backslashes, quotes, tabs, carriage returns, and newlines (encoded as literal \n, not space-replaced). Applied to both pass() and fail() functions for consistency. POSIX-portable.
findings.teachable_moment: A shared escape function applied uniformly is better than ad-hoc escaping at each call site. The awk approach avoids the sed pitfalls around newline handling.

findings.title: GitHub Actions secret bound via env — textbook CI security hardening
findings.description: The secret is now accessed through an environment variable binding, never interpolated into shell. This prevents shell metacharacter injection regardless of token format changes.
